result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Hulka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Hulka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order for Payment of Legal Fees

Defendant Joshua J Hulka in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended criminal complaint filed.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 2 & 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 Dismissed but read in.  Cts 2 & 3 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 18 months each count.  AODA and comply.  $443.00 costs each count.  No jail credit.

Defendant Joshua J Hulka in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Atty Davis requested a return date.  Hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
ADA Long requests Oct. 9th preliminary hearing be reset - witness not available
Defendant Joshua J Hulka in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
and Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Crystal Long.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Appointment filed by Atty Davis
faxed copy of Public Defender Evaluation Form received.

Court called 1:37 pm. Defendant, Joshua J Hulka, appeared. Petition is reviewed. Court finds def indigent and appoints Atty Richard Davis. Defendant to pay $100/mo starting 8-1-14.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 02:50 pm.  Hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 02:45 pm. Court adjourned 1:43 pm.
Indigency hearing on July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Joshua J Hulka, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is seeking atty.  Waives time limits.  New dates set.  Bond remains.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 02:10 pm.  Hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Joshua J Hulka, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.  Does not waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
